result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J. Rode was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence and not prior to 6 months after discharge from probation.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by the Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob J. Rode

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jacob J. Rode in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by the agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  
Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence and not prior to 6 month after discharge from probation.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jacob J. Rode in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   
Court to Address - Active Warrant for Non-Compliance with WCS.

Atty. Morin presented statements to the court.
Defendant starts treatment on 04/15/15.
State takes no position.

Court Quashes Warrant.
Bail is reinstated as previously fixed.
Any further non-compliance will result in a warrant being issued and significant cash bail being implemented.

For Non-Compliance with WCS.
Branch #5 - ONLY

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
03/31/15 - Court Reviewed - Court Orders, Warrant be Issued, Bail Revoked and Branch #5 ONLY.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jacob J. Rode in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with his mother or aunt listed in the complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Jacob J. Rode in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
